data-innereditablearea="cell3"><p style="line-height: 22px;"><strong><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><font style="font-size: 24px;">APA COMMITTEE ON LEGAL ISSUES (COLI) SEEKS NEW MEMBERS</font></font></strong></strong><strong><strong><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 13px;"><br></font></strong></strong></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;">The APA Committee on Legal Issues (COLI) is one of the most pertinent ways for AP-LS members to become better involved in APA governance and leadership activities. COLI makes recommendations, prepares and issues reports, and educates APA and psychologists about psycho-legal issues and to promote the field of psychology as it interfaces with the law. COLI does not serve as legal counsel to or form an attorney-client relationship with the APA or the Board of Directors. Instead, COLI has a primary responsibility for serving as a “think tank” for the Board of Directors on psycho-legal issues.&nbsp;</font><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif"><br></font></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;">Nominations are sought for one JD/PhD position and two PhD or PsyD positions. The term of service for all positions is Jan. 1, 2020-Dec. 31, 2022. COLI members must also be APA members. Applications should include (1) a brief statement of no more than 300 words detailing qualifications, and (2) a current curriculum vitae. Nominees' materials will be reviewed by COLI and COLI will send their recommendations to the Board of Directors for review. <strong>Applications are due September 27</strong> to <a href="mailto:COLInominations@apa.org">COLInominations@apa/org</a>.&nbsp;</font><br></p><p style="line-height: 18px;"><font face="Trebuchet MS,sans-serif" style="font-size: 16px;">For more information,
